    • Method Detail

      • exRunNode

        Node exRunNode(Node node)
        Runs a node Here there is a bit difference between Abiquo states and libcloud states, so this method is created to have better compatibility. In libcloud, if the node is not running, then it does not exist (avoiding UNKNOWN and temporal states). In Abiquo, you can define a node, and then deploy it. If the node is in :class:`NodeState.TERMINATED` libcloud's state and in 'NOT_DEPLOYED' Abiquo state, there is a way to run and recover it for libcloud using this method. There is no way to reach this state if you are using only libcloud, but you may have used another Abiquo client and now you want to recover your node to be used by libcloud.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to run (:type node: :class:`Node`)
        Returns:
        The node itself, but with the new state (:rtype: :class:`Node`)

      • exPopulateCache

        void exPopulateCache()
        Populate the cache. For each connection, it is good to store some objects that will be useful for further requests, such as the 'user' and the 'enterprise' objects. Executes the 'login' resource after setting the connection parameters and, if the execution is successful, it sets the 'user' object into cache. After that, it also requests for the 'enterprise' and 'locations' data. List of locations should remain the same for a single libcloud connection. However, this method is public and you are able to refresh the list of locations any time.

      • exCreateGroup

      • exDestroyGroup

        boolean exDestroyGroup(NodeGroup group)
        Destroy a group. Be careful! Destroying a group means destroying all the :class:`Node`s there and the group itself! If there is currently any action over any :class:`Node` of the :class:`NodeGroup`, then the method will raise an exception.
        Parameters:
        group - The group (required) (:type group: :class:`NodeGroup`)
        Returns:
        If the group was destroyed successfully (:rtype: ``bool``)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        `NodeGroup`
